His passive applies bork. If he E-AA-Q-AA-W-AA-E-AA he gets 8 bork procs in succession. Bork deals 6% current hp, so that's 0.94^8=~60% => deals ~40% max hp from bork procs alone.
That maths is wrong because he's dealing more damage with autos than BoRK procs so their %current HP will be lower. That and it's still physical damage which gets negated by armor.

> [{quoted}](name=Xenos11111,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jLkRldfh,comment-id=00060000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-27T07:12:09.896+0000)

> That maths is wrong because he's dealing more damage with autos than BoRK procs so their %current HP will be lower. That and it's still physical damage which gets negated by armor.

Good point. Although the armor also works in the other direction: mitigation from armor -> higher hp on the next shot -> more damage from BoRK.

He's binary, yes, but only really qualifies as "unfun" when you pick some stupid triple or quadra AD comp that he hard counters.

He is the definitive ADC counter.  If you pick three ADCs into a Rammus, you deserve to lose, just like if you pick multiple DoT mages into Galio or no CC into Kat.

Riot has said before that fighting a champion should not have reliance on only picks. The only times I have ever had any amount of fun vs a rammus is as things like yorick  who can cock block him easily. 

Is it fun to be point and click taught ed by a sonic knockoff any time during the game? Not really.

It's true that Riot doesn't want the game decided by picks.......usually.  However, that idea is actually used in the context of champions that can't be beaten without very specific matchups.  Rammus does not fall into that catagory.  Zero sustain, bad trading, generally meh damage, pretty mediocre against AP, shut down hard by heavy slows and roots, etc.

So yeah, Rammus has a wide variety of matchups he loses.  He hasn't changed much in the last several months, either.  The issue is that people are meta sheep and can't seem to realize that gee wizz, picking 3 ADCs into an anti-ADC champion is kinda stupid.

It's almost like he was DESIGNED to be an AD stomper or something.

Is it fun to die at any point in the game? Not really.

**PLOX REMOVE DEATH RITO!**

The very nature of a competitive multiplayer game is that at some point in the game, one player will have to not have fun for another player to have fun (just think about it, every time you have the best game of your life and win, someone on the other side just had the worst game ever and lost). Otherwise you've got a Co-op vs AI game instead of a MOBA. Just because CC isn't fun, or dying isn't fun, or getting bursted by a Graves isn't fun doesn't mean it shouldn't belong in the game.
Karthus is a champ who has fun in death.
He is an exception and still doesn't enjoy the 60+ seconds where he's staring at a gray screen late game.

And they will be right to do so. I don't care if he can jungle, but he should not be able to top lane. Taking him there circumvents his intended weakness of slow clear speed and lets him dominate any AD top laner 1v1 with almost no counterplay for a free lane.

Meanwhile ranged AD top hard counter most Melees and nobody bats an eye.

Rammus is weak as hell early game, cant clear waves, cant trade for shit and has terrible kill pressure. The sole reason he is seeing play is because he does well in the current meta and Malphite got nerfed.
And yet, despite all that, he has a 56% winrate in top lane. That's pretty good for a champ with a weak as hell early game, can't clear waves, can't trade for shit, and has terrible kill pressure.
_That's because he's very specifically countering ranged AD top._
And countering melee AD top. And other tanks.
